Food Policy Council of SA

Introducing Our New Web Site!

Posted on December 3, 2013 by joe

Welcome to our new website. It was developed in a collaboration with the Austin-based nonprofit Knowbility, that teaches and promotes web programming for accessibility. It’s like ADA for the internet. Since we are all about access to good food for all, we like the idea of promoting access to the world of ideas and everything else that the internet has to offer. Our world-class team of developers is from Rackspace’s Austin office.

This has been an exciting year for the Food Policy Council of San Antonio. We hosted our second annual conference in June, and were granted 501c3 status in August. We have lost a few board members to moves and other life events, and we’ve added a few as well.

We are looking for some key volunteers right now—we need a volunteer coordinator, and someone to help with communication and PR. If you know someone who might be interested (you, perhaps?) please consider this your invitation to let us know. Use this form to volunteer or send us the name of someone who might like to help.

Thank you for visiting the site. Look around and let us know what you think.

Like us on Facebook, and follow us on Twitter. Invite your friends to do the same. As always you can contact us at foodpolicysa@gmail.com and tell us what’s important to you about food.

Posted in Announcements
